clinical_particulars.therapeutic_indications: Examined for treatment of adrenocortical insufficiency especially in multiple sclerosis congenital cerebral palsy polyarteritis nodosa and rheumatoid arthritis Currently only approved in treating cats and dogs for the treatment of Addison s disease

contraindications.disease: Symptoms of overdose include polyuria polydipsia increased blood volume edema and cardiac enlargement
contraindications.pharmacodynamics: Used to treat adrenocortical insufficiency desoxycorticosterone pivalate is a mineralocorticoid hormone and an analogue of desoxycorticosterone It primarily acts on the metabolism of sodium potassium and water When the drug is given there is decreased excretion of sodium accompanied by increased excretion of potassium the concentration of sodium in the blood is thereby increased whereas that of potassium is decreased There is a concomitant increase in the volume of blood and extracellular fluids with a fall in hematocrit It increases the rate of renal tubular absorption of sodium

incompatibilities.description: The serum concentration of Desoxycorticosterone pivalate can be decreased when it is combined with Pitolisant
The metabolism of Desoxycorticosterone pivalate can be increased when combined with Metreleptin
The serum concentration of Desoxycorticosterone pivalate can be decreased when it is combined with Cenobamate
The serum concentration of Desoxycorticosterone pivalate can be increased when it is combined with Ritonavir
The serum concentration of Haloperidol can be increased when it is combined with Desoxycorticosterone pivalate
The metabolism of Tucatinib can be decreased when combined with Desoxycorticosterone pivalate
The serum concentration of Desoxycorticosterone pivalate can be increased when it is combined with Abametapir
The serum concentration of Desoxycorticosterone pivalate can be decreased when it is combined with Satralizumab
